item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Rickpwns, post:9, topic:272684”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=359952.msg2743855#msg2743855 date=1239517654]
The number 6.blahblah isn’t being divided, your strength bonus and level are. Making the 6.blahblah to something such as 3.blahblah will make you hit higher.
[/quote]
But, I don’t want to hit higher, want to hit lower. :l

So I would increase it?[/quote]
You would decrease it.

For example: 10/5 = 2, which means 2 is your max hit.
If you decrease the 5 to 2, it would look like 10/2 = 5, which means 5 is your max hit.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:6, topic:272684”] MaxHit += ((double) ((double) StrBonus + Strength) / ((double) 6.8275862068965517241379310344828));

/ Division operator

Lowering the number will increase your max hit due to the fact it is division. The smaller the number you divide by, the bigger the outcome.

StrBonus + Strength)

That is calculating your strength bonus and strength level to divide by the number.

You could probably search around your client class to find out what the ‘double’ does.

If you want some extra information on operators:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/opsummary.html

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/operators.html[/quote]
So really, all I would have to do is, make the numbers higher, due to the fact that it takes more to divide into? Will that work?

Read full topic

item.title: Need help!

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

MaxHit += ((double) ((double) StrBonus + Strength) / ((double) 6.8275862068965517241379310344828));

/ Division operator

Lowering the number will increase your max hit due to the fact it is division. The smaller the number you divide by, the bigger the outcome.

StrBonus + Strength)

That is calculating your strength bonus and strength level to divide by the number.

You could probably search around your client class to find out what the ‘double’ does.

If you want some extra information on operators:

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/opsummary.html

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/operators.html

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

((double) ((double) StrBonus + Strength)
/ ((double) 6.8275862068965517241379310344828));

Rewrite that. Like if you change it to 1+.25*(StrBonus) then you’d be hitting 1 plus whatever one fourth of your Strength Bonus is. It’s all math =]

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

[b]Alright guys, I need some help. I’ve been trying to fix the hits to make it a little bit more legit. Would I have to higher these values to make it hit more legit? I already lowered them, and it hit higher, but I’m not sure.

Here is what it looks like:[/b]

double MaxHit = 0;
int StrBonus = playerBonus[10]; // Strength Bonus
int Strength = playerLevel[playerStrength]; // Strength

    if (FightType == 1 || FightType == 4) { // Accurate & Defensive
        MaxHit += ((double) ((double) StrBonus + Strength)
                / ((double) [b]6.8275862068965517241379310344828[/b]));
    } else if (FightType == 2) { // Aggresive
        MaxHit += ((double) ((double) StrBonus + Strength)
                / ((double) [b]6.6551724137931034482758620689655[/b]));
    } else if (FightType == 3) { // Controlled
        MaxHit += ((double) ((double) StrBonus + Strength)
                / ((double) [b]6.7586206896551724137931034482759[/b]));
    }

Read full topic
